document_data.caption: Pistis Sophia, the Ascetic.
document_data.name: Pistis Sophia
document_data.mainbody: '''Pistis Sophia''', the Ascetic, Her symbol was the [[eagle]].
document_data.Description: Pistis Sophia was a beautiful, eight-foot-tall [[tome archon]]. She had an androgynous body with subtle feminine traits. From her back grew transparent, silver-feathered wings that caught the light. She had skin that shone like polished crystal the color of indigo, and her eyes were bright and green. Her hair was silver.
document_data.Personality:
Pistis Sophia had a countenance that embodied sincerity and serenity. Even if forced to fight, she never displayed a temper or even a scowl. To gaze upon her gentle face filled viewers with hope.

She never spoke a lie, believing that truth was required for pure harmony and happiness. A true ascetic, Pistis Sophia had no desires for material possessions; indeed, she encouraged others to cast aside their possessions—even their clothing—and live lives of contentment. She believed that possessions signified insecurity and greed.
document_data.Abilities:
Much like a [[monk]], Pistis Sophia had mastered the art of using her hands and feet as weapons. Her hands were considered [[Holy (weapon qualtiy)|holy]] weapons, and if she struck an evil creature, it was ravaged by [[golden ice]]. She had exceptional reflexes and skills at evasion, and—also like a monk—she had the wholeness of body to heal any wounds she endured.

Furthermore, Pistis Sophia had all of the powers common to tome archons. In addition to these, unique magical abilities were available to her. She could [[detect chaos]] and [[True seeing|see any creature as they truly were]]. By thought alone, she could surround her head with a flaming [[crown of brilliance]] so bright as to blind foes, [[Etherealness|enter the Ethereal Plane]], [[Greater dispelling|dispel all but the most powerful magical effects]], [[Ray of hope|instill hope in subjects within range]], [[remove fatigue]], [[Sending|send a short message to an individual anywhere in the multiverse]], [[Shield of the archons|defend herself with a mystical shield]], [[Sword of conscience|fill an evil creature with intense feelings of remorse]], and grant a subject a [[Vision of heaven|vision of the Seven Heavens]]. With a single, spoken [[holy word]], she could slay or banish wicked beings, and she could [[Message|whisper messages]] to recipients at a distance.

Once per day, Pistis Sophia could perform a [[miracle]]. Three times per day, she could [[Heart's ease|put one's heart at ease]] or overcome enemies with [[waves of exhaustion]]. She was also immune to magical hindrances against her movement.
document_data.Possessions: In keeping with her philosophy, Pistis Sophia had no possessions, nor did she have a palace from which she ruled. She never used weapons, only relying on her fists and feet if combat were necessary.
document_data.Activities:
[[File:Initiate of Pistis Sophia.jpg|thumb|right|''A [[cervidal]] [[initiate of Pistis Sophia]].'']]
Pistis Sophia spent her time visiting the assortment of [[cathedral]]s and [[monasteries]] that dotted the heavenly landscape of Solania. She also enjoyed walking with [[petitioner]]s or [[pilgrim]]s through Solania's foggy valleys.

In the Realms, some [[lawful good]] [[cleric]]s dedicated themselves to Pistis Sophia's cause. While she could not grant spells directly, she would petition their [[patron deity]] to grant them access to [[Celestial domain|unique spells]] and an ability to [[smite evil|smite evil foes]] with greater force.
document_data.Relationships: One of Pistis Sophia's champions was [[Drusulai]], a [[half-celestial]] [[dwarven]] [[paladin]] of [[Moradin]] who guarded the armories of [[Erackinor]]. When Drusulai first met Pistis Sophia, he was filled with awe at her presence. She kissed his [[waraxe]], enchanting it with [[Righteous (weapon quality)|righteous power]].
